channel.title: Problem playing new server
channel.description:
Hey, I just downloaded a rsps source and I have decided to create my own rsps based off this, when I go to play the rsps, it is completely fun until I log in then this message is spammed from what I believe every file in the client folder, I may be wrong.
[url=http://gyazo.com/525244f9ae3ee89f4c3247ef7472883f]http://gyazo.com/525244f9ae3ee89f4c3247ef7472883f[/url] [url=http://gyazo.com/9479c3529641b0f7e28324b368f48fe0]http://gyazo.com/9479c3529641b0f7e28324b368f48fe0[/url]
Please help, thanks

item.title: Problem playing new server
item.dc:creator: @doleo123 doleo123
item.description:
@doleo123 wrote:

I am almost certain now that it is a problem connecting to the cache, as these files that it is having trouble opening look like they’re in the cache. It seems to be not connecting I believe but I cannot work out for the life of me why, I searched for every connection to the cache and made sure it was to the right file but it still seems not to work.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem playing new server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“doleo123, post:5, topic:546988”]When I log on I am able to move around but I can barely do anything because that first pic I linked is constantly being spammed and it’s using all of my processing speed. It’s coming from the client file as that windows explorer window also opens as the messages begin to spam.

I have a feeling that the problem comes from the client not being linking to these files or something or as it says I do not have a correct program to open them? I got JDK and stuff so the only reasonable explanation I can think of is my environmental variables are wrong which doesn’t let me use those files.[/quote]
If you’re playing the server, and randomly files are trying to be opened like that… Well I can think of only 2 things: somewhere in the code, it’s executing a command to open a file. Or, you have a file selected and as you play you tried opening it (not likely, but yea…).

To find the code executing it, if there is some… That may or may not be easy.
You’re going to have to dig in like all the files and look for it, and you’d also have to know what to look for…

You could try getting a new source and server, see if that one works without your issue. if so, then the other one might of had some code as a form of leech protection or something…

Read full topic

item.title: Problem playing new server
item.dc:creator: @doleo123 doleo123
item.description:
@doleo123 wrote:

When I log on I am able to move around but I can barely do anything because that first pic I linked is constantly being spammed and it’s using all of my processing speed. It’s coming from the client file as that windows explorer window also opens as the messages begin to spam.

I have a feeling that the problem comes from the client not being linking to these files or something or as it says I do not have a correct program to open them? I got JDK and stuff so the only reasonable explanation I can think of is my environmental variables are wrong which doesn’t let me use those files.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem playing new server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“doleo123, post:3, topic:546988”]Yeah the issue is confusing me too, I’ve spent a few hours looking into it.
I was thinking it came from the cache file as all the files are in the 1 folder, there is no src or bin, here’s a pic

http://gyazo.com/5d90818a8b6489aea0416d9479b5671e

I was thinking it could be environmental variables because I don’t know what to set the System variables there to.[/quote]
I’m still not understanding your issue, exactly…
It’s creating files? Or what?
The pic you just showed, is fine.
I see literally nothing wrong with the files…
.class files are compiled Java files.
.java files are java source files.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem playing new server
item.dc:creator: @doleo123 doleo123
item.description:
@doleo123 wrote:

Yeah the issue is confusing me too, I’ve spent a few hours looking into it.
I was thinking it came from the cache file as all the files are in the 1 folder, there is no src or bin, here’s a pic

http://gyazo.com/5d90818a8b6489aea0416d9479b5671e

I was thinking it could be environmental variables because I don’t know what to set the System variables there to.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem playing new server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I have no idea what you’re talking about. How is a message spammed from a file?
If you could give better pictures of your issue (instead of pictures of you trying to open a file with a file format that your computer doesn’t know) it might help more… And maybe better details on the issue…

Read full topic
